“ Work together with your team to escort minions into the enemy portal. No roles, no lanes, no pressure. Just a five-on-five brawl.
â€” Client description

Brawl is a team-deathmatch Featured Game Mode in League of Legends. The game mode was released for Act 1 of Spirit Blossom Beyond, in patch V25.10.

Run Info: Brawl is available during Act 1 of Spirit Blossom Beyond and will be disabled with the end of the V25.12 patch cycle.

Overview[edit | edit source]

  • Draft Type: Blind pick
  • Mode: Escort/Team-Deathmatch PvP
  • Map: The Bandlewood 5v5
  • Average Game Length: 10 minutes

Lobby[edit | edit source]

There are no requirements for playing Brawl. Players can join by simply having an account.

The lobby functionality is similar to Swiftplay, where players choose their loadout from a menu that is opened by clicking on the square portrait within their banner. Each player selects one champion (which includes the Free champion rotation), their runes and their summoner spells. And all champions must be unique when playing in a pre-made party.

Available summoner spells include: Cleanse, Flash, Ghost, Heal, Ignite, and Barrier. All other summoner spells have been disabled.

Within a premade party, players must mark themselves 'Ready' by clicking on the large button at the bottom center. The party leader will be able mark themselves 'Ready' and start the queue after everyone else is ready. There is no champion select screen; players will immediately enter the game when all 10 players have accepted the AFK check.

Features[edit | edit source]

Map[edit | edit source]

  • There is only one lane.
    • The area of the entire lane cannot be engulfed in the Fog of War and will always be revealed to both teams. For each team, only the jungle and the opposing team's base are subject to the Fog of War.
  • There is a base gate that blocks champions from leaving the base for the first 15 seconds of the game.
  • In addition to the Nexus Obelisk, each team's spawn has two turrets that guard the entrances. These turrets are untargetable and will attack any enemies in range.

Objective[edit | edit source]

Teams start with 250 team health. The first team to reduce the enemy team's health to 0 wins:

  • Killing enemy champions deals 5 damage to their team health.
  • Killing enemy minions deals 1 damage to their team health. This rule will stop for a team when the enemy team is at a low enough team health.
  • Escorting allied minions through the enemy's Bandle portal deals 1 damage to their team health.

When the difference of points between teams is large enough, the losing team is compensated with the Yordle Magic buff:

  • Yordle Magic: Deal 20% increased damage and gain 20% damage reduction. This effect lasts permanently until the difference of points between teams is small enough.

Surrendering is available only from 15:00 onward and has a cooldown of 3 minutes. The vote needs 4 out of 5 players or 70% of the team to pass.

Minions[edit | edit source]

  • Spawning starts at 0:30.
  • Minions take 75% damage from AoE damage.
  • Minion waves spawn every 25 seconds and consist of two melee minions and two caster minions.
  • Siege minions will spawn in every other alternating wave between Red and Blue side. With the first minion spawning for the Red side team.

Champions[edit | edit source]

  • Champions start the game at level 3.
  • After 0:20, Homeguard is enabled for the remainder of the match, granting champions 165% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds while at their respective spawn. The bonus refreshes every 0.5 seconds while they remain in the area and decays in strength over the last 0.75 seconds of its duration.
  • Champions are awarded the On Fire! buff when they score enough champion takedowns in a row without dying. This buff is lost upon death but otherwise lasts indefinitely.
    • On Fire!: Gain increased damage, bonus movement speed, 20% bonus attack speed, bonus HP, and halved basic ability cooldowns. However, you also take increased damage and your kill bounty is increased, granting your killer and their assisting allies an abundant amount of gold.
  • All champions on the The Bandlewood map gain the Bandlewood Aura e buff.

All champions gain the following bonuses:

  • +100 summoner spell haste
  • Increase your base mana by 100%.
  • Gain 5 experience per second, increased to 7.5 after 5:00.
  • Generate 150 per 10 seconds, increased to 200 after 5:00.
  • Nearby enemy minion and monster deaths grant gold, shared among allies.
  • Gain Empowered Recall.

Exclusive items[edit | edit source]

  • Cappa Juice
  • Guardian's Blade
  • Guardian's Hammer
  • Guardian's Horn
  • Guardian's Orb
  • Scouting Ahead (automatically and permanently occupies the trinket slot)

Jungle[edit | edit source]

The Jungle exists outside of the minion lane, beyond the walls at the side, and features water ponds (river).

Monster camps[edit | edit source]

Blue Sentinel
  • Located at the left and the right sides of the map near each team's respective spawn.
  • Spawns at 1:00 and respawns 2 minutes after it is slain.
  • Grants a local 450 split among the slayer and allies near the camp.
  • Buff is granted to the killer only.
Red Brambleback
  • Located at the left and right sides of the map near each team's respective spawn.
  • Spawns at 1:00 and respawns 2 minutes after it is slain.
  • Grants a local 450 split among the slayer and allies near the camp.
  • Buff is granted to the killer only.
Gromp
  • Located between the buff monsters on the left side of the map.
  • Spawns at 0:45 and respawns 90 seconds after it is slain.
  • Grants a local 300 split among the slayer and allies near the camp.
Greater Murk Wolf
  • Located between the buff monsters on the right side of the map.
  • Spawns at 0:45 and respawns 90 seconds after it is slain.
  • Grants a local 300 split among the slayer and allies near the camp.

Jungle plants[edit | edit source]

Blast Cone
  • Located behind each side wall.
  • Spawns at 0:30 and respawns 85 seconds after being destroyed.
Honeyfruit
  • Located in the middle opening at the top side and behind the right side walls, as well as near the Blue Sentinel camps.
  • Spawns at 1:00 and respawns 170 seconds after being destroyed.

Click on the tabs above for more information.

General[edit | edit source]

  • Elementalist Lux transforms much earlier into the game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Brawl was prototyped during Thunderdome 2024, Riot's annual internal hackathon.[1][2]
    • As an Easter egg, a figure of a gnome wearing a thunder cap is hidden in a flower pot, serving as a name pun ("Trundergnome") on the project's name.
  • Each Bandle Portal displays a different location on the other side, randomly selected for each player. The possible locations include:
    • Howling Abyss
    • Temple of Lily and Lotus
    • Summoner's Rift
    • Bridge of Progress
  • The Order side shopkeeper stall is hosted by Norra, while the Chaos-side stall is hosted by Kobuko.
    • Yuumi can be seen sleeping beside Norra near her shopkeeper stall at the Order-side fountain. If a player on the Order team has selected Yuumi, she will not appear there.

League of Legends
League of Legends (or LoL; initially League of Legends: Clash of Fates) is a multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) genre video game developed by Riot Games.

Platform
  • Microsoft Windows, macOS
Regular Map
  • Summoner's Rift

League of Legends content
Brawl
The Bandlewood is located somewhere in Bandle City. It is also the map where Brawl is played on.

Brawl is a team-deathmatch Featured Game Mode in League of Legends. The game mode was released in patch V25.10 during Spirit Blossom Beyond.

Featured Game Modes
  • Brawl (5v5)

League of Legends content
Turret
A turret, also called a tower, is a fortification that defends a part of territory. It provides vision of the area and autonomously fires homing bolts at nearby enemies, establishing a defensive ground for allies. Turrets are most notable in Classic, defending against waves of enemy Minions from their ultimate goal of destroying the nexus. Champions work to destroy enemy turrets to push their assault into the enemies' territory. Turrets visually fall apart as they take damage.
League of Legends content
Untargetable
A unit that is untargetable is an invalid target; it can neither be selected nor hit by most effects. Effects that have already been applied are not invalidated by the unit becoming untargetable, unless they are special-cased to do so.

Becoming untargetable will interrupt acqusition. This also causes non-champions to lose aggro. Many untargetabilities additionally destroy all incoming unit-targeted projectiles.

League of Legends content
Bandlewood Aura
All champions on the The Bandlewood map gain the following bonuses:

  • +100 summoner spell haste
  • Increase your base mana by 100%.
  • Gain 5 experience per second, increased to 7.5 after 5:00.
  • Generate 150 per 10 seconds, increased to 200 after 5:00.
  • Nearby enemy minion and monster deaths grant gold, shared among allies.
  • Gain Empowered Recall.

League of Legends content
Classic
Classic Mode refers to the game where the primary goal is to destroy the enemy Nexus.

Defending each Nexus are several turrets and inhibitors; each structure blocks the advancement of enemy minion waves and champions to the Nexus, and must be destroyed in sequence for each lane. Destroying the last structure alive in at least one lane grants access to the Nexus. Turrets right before the Nexus do not correspond to any specific lane.

  • A turret (or tower) is a heavy fortification that attacks enemies on sight.
  • An inhibitor does not attack, but when a lane's inhibitor is destroyed, the opposite Nexus will spawn super minions within the same lane, allowing for even faster advancement.

League of Legends content
 Perfect Execution COOLDOWN: 120 / 90 / 60
Active: Akali dashes in the direction of the target enemy champion, dealing physical damage to enemies she passes through.
Perfect Execution can be recast within a period.
Recast: Akali dashes in the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies she passes through based on their missing health.
League of Legends content
 Breath of Light COOLDOWN: 3
Active: Aurelion Sol charges up to a short time, exhaling a beam in the target direction that continuously deals magic damage to the first enemy hit and reduced damage to other enemies. Aurelion Sol can steer the beam in any direction.
The beam will deal a burst of bonus magic damage for each full second that it damages the same enemy, and generates Stardust if the target is a champion.
At max rank, Breath of Light's channel duration may last indefinitely.
League of Legends content
 Singularity COOLDOWN: 12
Active: Aurelion Sol conjures a black hole at the target location for a few seconds that continually deals magic damage to enemies within. Enemies in the black hole are dragged toward the center. Enemies within the center are executed at low health.
After Singularity ends, it generates Stardust for each full second that enemy champions were inside, as well as for each enemy takedown.
League of Legends content
 Falling Star COOLDOWN: 120 / 110 / 100
Active: Aurelion Sol calls down a star that strikes the target location, dealing magic damage and briefly stunning enemies hit. This generates Stardust for each enemy champion hit.
After gathering enough Stardust, the next cast of Falling Star transforms into The Skies Descend, empowering the impact with new effects.
 The Skies Descend

Active: Aurelion Sol calls down a giant star that strikes the target location, dealing increased magic damage in a larger area and briefly knocking up enemies hit.

This sends a massive shockwave that rapidly expands outward, briefly slowing all enemies hit, and dealing magic damage to enemy champions and epic monsters.

League of Legends content
 Traveler's Call STATIC CD: 50 / 8 â€“ 4 (based on number of Chimes)
Innate - Ancient Chimes: Bard's presence causes magical chimes to appear across the map. Collecting a chime grants him  experience,  mana, and a burst of  movement speed.
Meeps: Bard generates meeps that are each consumed in his basic attacks, dealing bonus magic damage. Collecting chimes causes these meeps to be ready more often and gain new effects.

  • At 5 chimes, Meeps apply a slow to enemies.
  • At 15 chimes, Meeps deal damage to nearby enemies and in a cone behind the target.
  • At 35 chimes, the cone's radius increases.

League of Legends content
 Death in Lavender
Innate: Bel'Veth's attack speed cap is greatly increased, but her  attack speed does not grow by  leveling up. The damage dealt by her basic attacks (including on-hit effects) is reduced.
Innate: Bel'Veth's ability casts generate stacks of Death in Lavender, which lasts a few seconds and stacks up to a cap. While Bel'Veth has stacks, she becomes ghosted and gains  bonus attack speed. Her basic attacks consume stacks.
Innate: When Bel'Veth scores a takedown against an enemy champion or monster, she generates a permanent stack of Lavender.
Lavender: For each stack, Bel'Veth gains  bonus attack speed.
League of Legends content
 The Hextech Ultimatum COOLDOWN: 140 / 115 / 90
Active: Camille dives onto an enemy champion, creating a zone around the target and knocking away all other enemies.
While within the zone, the target cannot escape through any means, and Camille's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage against them.
The zone will disappear if Camille leaves or dies.
League of Legends content
 Feast COOLDOWN: 80 / 70 / 60
Active: Cho'Gath devours an enemy, dealing true damage based on Cho'Gath's bonus health. If this attack kills the target, Cho'Gath gains a permanent Feast stack that infinitely stacks.
Feast: For each stack, Cho'Gath gains  bonus health,  bonus attack range and increased size.
League of Legends content
 Last Caress COOLDOWN: 120 / 100 / 80
Active: Evelynn briefly goes untargetable and decimates the area in front of her, dealing magic damage to enemies within, increased against low-health targets. She then blinks backwards over a distance.
League of Legends content
 Crowstorm COOLDOWN: 140 / 110 / 80
Active: Fiddlesticks channels, then blinks to the target location surrounded by a murder of crows, continually dealing magic damage to nearby enemies.
League of Legends content
 Hero's Entrance COOLDOWN: 180 / 160 / 140
Active: Galio guards the target allied champion, channelling for a short time and granting his magic damage shield to himself and all allied champions in the area.
After a short delay, Galio rises unstoppably and intangibly before crashing down onto the target's initial location, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies and knocking them back.
League of Legends content
 Parrrley COOLDOWN: 4.5
Active: Gangplank shoots the target enemy with his pistol, dealing physical damage and applying on-hit and on-attack effects.
If this attack kills the target, he gains gold and Silver Serpents.
League of Legends content
 Parrrley COOLDOWN: 4.5
Active: Gangplank shoots the target enemy with his pistol, dealing physical damage and applying on-hit and on-attack effects.
If this attack kills the target, he gains gold and Silver Serpents.
League of Legends content
 Cannon Barrage COOLDOWN: 170 / 150 / 130
Active: Gangplank orders a cannon bombardment to the target location, each blast deals magic damage and slows enemies within.
Gangplank can improve Cannon Barrage by purchasing upgrades in the shop with Silver Serpents.
League of Legends content
 Spirit of Dread COOLDOWN: 14
Active: Hecarim continually deals magic damage to nearby enemies for a short time.
During this time, he gains bonus resistances and heals for a portion of any damage he and his allies deal to nearby enemies, with reduced healing on ally damage.
League of Legends content
 Onslaught of Shadows COOLDOWN: 140 / 120 / 100
Active: Hecarim summons spectral riders and charges in the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies they pass through.
Upon arrival, he fears and gradually slows enemies for a duration based on the distance traveled.
League of Legends content
 Vanguard's Edge COOLDOWN: 125 / 105 / 85
Active: Irelia launches a barrage of blades in the target direction that expand outward upon hitting an enemy champion, dealing magic damage to enemies hit.
After expanding, the blades form a spade-shaped perimeter around the enemy champion hit for a short time. Enemies that pass through the blades for the first time are dealt magic damage and slowed.
League of Legends content
 Friend of the Forest
Innate: Ivern cannot attack nor damage non-epic monsters. When he targets a jungle camp, he plants a magical grove under it at the cost of health and mana.
The grove charges up over time to fully mature, upon which Ivern can then target the monsters to instantly clear the camp. Using Smite on a monster in the grove will clear the camp regardless of maturity.
League of Legends content
 Fate's Call COOLDOWN: 160 / 140 / 120
Active: Kalista invokes her tether to retrieve her Oathsworn, vanishing and cleansing them from all crowd control, and hold them for a few seconds.
While held, the Oathsworn may dash to reappear at the target location. If they collide with an enemy champion, they knock up all nearby enemies.
League of Legends content
 Requiem COOLDOWN: 200 / 180 / 160
Active: Karthus channels for a short time, then deals magic damage to all targetable enemy champions upon completion.
League of Legends content
 The Darkin Scythe
Innate: Whenever Kayn scores champion takedowns or deals damage against champions, he earns orbs that unlocks his Darkin and Shadow Assassin forms. Kayn can return to the summoning platform to transform, permanently empowering his abilities.
Shadow Assassin Bonus: If Kayn has been out of combat for a period, his attacks deal bonus magic damage for a short time upon entering combat.

Darkin Bonus: Rhaast heals for a portion of the damage he deals to enemy champions with his abilities.
League of Legends content
 Mark of the Kindred TARGET IMMUNITY: 240
Innate: Both Lamb and Wolf mark targets to hunt. Scoring a takedown against a hunted target collects a permanent stack of Mark of the Kindred. Lamb can select an enemy champion to hunt, and Wolf automatically selects a large monster to hunt.
Mark of the Kindred: Lamb gains  bonus range on her basic attacks and Mounting Dread. For each stack, Kindred's abilities become more potent.
League of Legends content
 Lamb's Respite COOLDOWN: 180 / 150 / 120
Active: Lamb blesses the ground under herself for a few seconds. Any unit inside the area will become invulnerable upon reaching low health.
Units within the area are healed when the blessing ends.
League of Legends content
 Final Spark COOLDOWN: 60 / 50 / 40
Active: Lux fires a massive light beam in a line in the target direction that deals magic damage and briefly reveals enemies hit.
League of Legends content
 Breath of Life COOLDOWN: 160 / 145 / 130
Active: Milio explodes in soothing flames, healing and cleansing himself and nearby allied champions of non- airborne crowd control and granting them tenacity for a short time.
League of Legends content
 Siphoning Strike COOLDOWN: 7.5 / 6.5 / 5.5 / 4.5 / 3.5
Active: Nasus' next basic attack within a period will gain  bonus range and deal bonus physical damage based on the amount of Siphoning Strike stacks.
If this attack kills the target, Nasus generates permanent stacks of Siphoning Strike, increased against champions, large minions, and large monsters.
League of Legends content
 Paranoia COOLDOWN: 140 / 115 / 90
Active: Nocturne terrorizes all enemy champions, nearsighting them for a few seconds. He can recast Paranoia during this time.
Recast: Nocturne dashes with displacement immunity to the target enemy champion, dealing physical damage upon arrival.
displacement immunity: The dash cannot be deterred by crowd control.
League of Legends content
 Grand Starfall COOLDOWN: 180 / 165 / 150
Passive: Pantheon gains  armor penetration.
Active: Pantheon channels, then leaps high into the air. After a short time, he throws a spear at the target location that deals physical damage to nearby enemies and slows them.
Pantheon then crashes down and creates a shockwave alongside himself that travels toward the target location, dealing magic damage to enemies hit.
Pantheon gains full stacks of Mortal Will upon landing.
League of Legends content
 Supreme Display of Talent COOLDOWN: 120
Active: Qiyana sweeps a windblast in the target direction that knocks back enemies hit and stops upon hitting Terrain.
The windblast creates a cascading shockwave across any River or Brush it passes, as well as around the borders of Terrain it hits. The shockwave briefly stuns enemies hit and deals physical damage based on their maximum health.
League of Legends content
 Void Rush COOLDOWN: 100 / 90 / 80
Passive: Rek'Sai marks enemy champions she damages with Marked as Prey, which lasts a few seconds.
Active: Rek'Sai selects the target Marked as Prey, becoming displacement immune and vanishing into the ground. After a brief delay, she emerges Un-Burrowed and pounces at the target, dealing physical damage based on their missing health.
displacement immunity: The dash cannot be deterred by crowd control.
League of Legends content
 Dominus COOLDOWN: 120 / 100 / 80
Active: Renekton empowers himself for some time, gaining Fury,  bonus health, bonus size,  bonus attack range, and increased area on Cull the Meek.
During this time, Renekton creates an aura that continually deals magic damage to nearby enemies. He also continually generates Fury, up to a cap.
League of Legends content
 Thrill of the Hunt COOLDOWN: 100 / 90 / 80
Passive: Rengar also gains Unseen Predator while camouflaged.
Active: Rengar prowls for some time, gaining  bonus movement speed. After a short delay, he also becomes camouflaged.
During this time, Rengar will detect the nearest enemy champion in range, revealing them for the remaining full duration. As he approaches, he will mark the nearest detected enemy.

Rengar's next basic attack will deal bonus physical damage, then  reduce the target's armor for a few seconds.
League of Legends content
 Realm Warp COOLDOWN: 180 / 160 / 140
Passive: Overload's Flux empowered damage is increased.
Active: Ryze channels for a short time to open a portal beneath him. Ryze can act during the channel, but the portal will cancel if he is interrupted.
Upon completion, allies within the portal will blink to the target location.
League of Legends content
 Absolution TARGET IMMUNITY: 6 / 5 / 4 (based on level)
Innate - Weakened Soul: Senna's basic attacks and abilities against enemy champions apply a stack of Mist for a few seconds. Subsequent hits collect the Mist, dealing bonus physical damage based on the target's current health and rendering the target immune to further Mist applications for a few seconds.
Enemies that die near Senna may spawn a Mist Wrath from their corpse, which lasts for a period. She can kill Mist Wraiths to gain gold and Mist stacks.
Innate - Relic Cannon: Senna's basic attacks deal bonus physical damage and briefly grant her  bonus movement speed based on the target's movement speed.
Mist: For each stack, Senna gains  bonus attack damage. For every few stacks, she also gains  bonus attack range and  critical strike chance, or  life steal if she has max critical strike chance.
